title: Sydney .NET User Group: Security devolution with Troy Hunt
thumbnailDescription: Sydney .NET User Group: Security devolution with Troy Hunt
eventShortDescription:
​Sydney .NET User Group: Security devolution with Troy Hunt - HTTPS + content security + CAA + WTF

Web security has come a long way in recent years and these days, there’s a whole bunch of browser security features that can not only make your site more secure than ever, but make your job as a developer even easier. But the features remain largely unused with many developers not knowing of their existence nor how to properly leverage them.

In this talk you’ll see the mechanics of a whole bunch of acronyms you’ve probably never heard of before, but will witness firsthand as they’re put into action. You’ll see the attacks they prevents, how to implement them and ultimately, how they help better protect the apps you’re building.

About the presenter:
Troy is a Microsoft Regional Director and MVP, Pluralsight author and world-renowned internet security specialist. He spends his time teaching developers how to break into their own systems before helping to piece them back together to be secure against today’s online threats. He’s also the creator of “Have I been pwned?”, the free online service for breach monitoring and notifications. Troy regularly blogs at troyhunt.com from his home in Australia.

Can't come in person? No worries!
We live stream the event so you can watch it from anywhere! Catch all the action live on Wednesday July 25from 6:30pm here: https://www.ssw.com.au/ssw/Live
